--- title: "FINAL PROJECT" author: "Priya Marla" desription: "Data Analysis for Hotel Bookings" date: "01/31/2023" format: html: toc: true code-fold: true code-copy: true code-tools: true categories: - hotel_booking --- ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(epiDisplay) library(dbplyr) library(tidyverse) library(here) library(lubridate) library(summarytools) library(ggplot2) library(countrycode) library(purrr) library(plotly) knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) ``` ::: ## Introduction Hotel industry has always been in the boom, with more analysis of the data available for bookings, will help the industry increase their profits by improving in few aspects. The goal of this project is to analyse 2 different type of hotels. It contains booking information of Resort Hotel and City Hotel between July 2015 and August 2017. These two hotels are majorly located in Portugal and also have branches in different parts of the world. The dataset features columns of type character and double which describes information regarding the bookings in each hotel like the hotel information (hotel, country), arrival information (date, number of people, number of days of stay), cancellations (previous_cancellations, previous_bookings_not_canceled), customer information and preferences (company, customer_type, meal, required_car_parking_spaces) and few logistics regaring the bookings. ## Read in data Reading the data from "hotel_bookings.csv" file. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dataset <- here("posts","_data","hotel_bookings.csv") %>% read_csv() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Rows: 119390 Columns: 32 ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr (13): hotel, arrival_date_month, meal, country, market_segment, distrib... dbl (18): is_canceled, lead_time, arrival_date_year, arrival_date_week_numb... date (1): reservation_status_date ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} dataset ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 119,390 × 32 hotel is_ca…¹ lead_…² arriv…³ arriv…⁴ arriv…⁵ arriv…⁶ stays…⁷ stays…⁸ adults 1 Resor… 0 342 2015 July 27 1 0 0 2 2 Resor… 0 737 2015 July 27 1 0 0 2 3 Resor… 0 7 2015 July 27 1 0 1 1 4 Resor… 0 13 2015 July 27 1 0 1 1 5 Resor… 0 14 2015 July 27 1 0 2 2 6 Resor… 0 14 2015 July 27 1 0 2 2 7 Resor… 0 0 2015 July 27 1 0 2 2 8 Resor… 0 9 2015 July 27 1 0 2 2 9 Resor… 1 85 2015 July 27 1 0 3 2 10 Resor… 1 75 2015 July 27 1 0 3 2 # … with 119,380 more rows, 22 more variables: children , babies , # meal , country , market_segment , # distribution_channel , is_repeated_guest , # previous_cancellations , previous_bookings_not_canceled , # reserved_room_type , assigned_room_type , booking_changes , # deposit_type , agent , company , days_in_waiting_list , # customer_type , adr , required_car_parking_spaces , … ``` ::: ::: ## Narrative of Dataset From the summarytools output dataframe, we can see the stats of various values of each column. For example here we can see that there are 2 types of hotels(data type - character) and 66.4% people have their bookings in City hotel and rest in Resort hotel. Is_canceled column describes whether the booking has been canceled (numeric value 1) or not canceled (numeric value 0). 63% of the customers don't cancel their reservations whereas 37% customers cancel their reservations. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} print(summarytools::dfSummary(dataset, varnumbers = FALSE, plain.ascii = FALSE, style = "grid", graph.magnif = 0.70, valid.col = FALSE), method = 'render', table.classes = 'table-condensed') ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

2023-02-04

``` ::: ::: ## Tidy Data (as needed) The data needs to be cleaned. The date is spread across in multiple columns. If is there in a single column it'll will be easy to calculate stats. Can also calculate the date with lead time and date of arrival columns. The country column is placed in the 14th place, it can be moved up to 2nd place i.e after the hotel column. Created a new column arrival_date by getting the date from "arrival_date_day_of_month", "arrival_date_month","arrival_date_year" columns. Removing these 3 columns and moving the arrival date column to column after "lead_time". Creating the new column booking_date to know the date of booking with the information from columns lead_time and arrival_date. Modifying the acronyms in country column and meal column to show full names. Removing the company and agent columns as most of the entries are NULL. After tidying up the data, total columns remaining are 29 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dplyr::select(dataset, 3:7 ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 119,390 × 5 lead_time arrival_date_year arrival_date_month arrival_date_week_nu…¹ arriv…² 1 342 2015 July 27 1 2 737 2015 July 27 1 3 7 2015 July 27 1 4 13 2015 July 27 1 5 14 2015 July 27 1 6 14 2015 July 27 1 7 0 2015 July 27 1 8 9 2015 July 27 1 9 85 2015 July 27 1 10 75 2015 July 27 1 # … with 119,380 more rows, and abbreviated variable names # ¹​arrival_date_week_number, ²​arrival_date_day_of_month ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #tidying the dataset tidy_data <- dataset %>% drop_na() %>% relocate("country",.after = "hotel") %>% #to get full names of the acronymns in country column mutate(arrival_date = (str_c(arrival_date_day_of_month,arrival_date_month,arrival_date_year, sep = "/")) , arrival_date = dmy(arrival_date), .after = lead_time) %>% #variable for arrival date mutate(booking_date = arrival_date-days(lead_time), .after = lead_time) %>% #variable to know the date of booking dplyr::select(-c("lead_time", "company", "agent", "arrival_date_day_of_month", "arrival_date_week_number")) %>% mutate(meal=recode(meal, BB="Bed and Breakfast", FB="Full board", HB="Half board", SC="Undefined")) tidy_data$country <- countrycode(tidy_data$country, origin = "iso3c", destination = "country.name", origin_regex = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning in countrycode_convert(sourcevar = sourcevar, origin = origin, destination = dest, : Some values were not matched unambiguously: CN, NULL, TMP ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} tidy_data <- tidy_data[,-6:-9] #removed columns with arrival date information tidy_data ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 119,386 × 25 hotel country is_ca…¹ booking_…² arrival_…³ adults child…⁴ babies meal 1 Resort Hot… Portug… 0 2014-07-24 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Bed … 2 Resort Hot… Portug… 0 2013-06-24 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Bed … 3 Resort Hot… United… 0 2015-06-24 2015-07-01 1 0 0 Bed … 4 Resort Hot… United… 0 2015-06-18 2015-07-01 1 0 0 Bed … 5 Resort Hot… United… 0 2015-06-17 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Bed … 6 Resort Hot… United… 0 2015-06-17 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Bed … 7 Resort Hot… Portug… 0 2015-07-01 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Bed … 8 Resort Hot… Portug… 0 2015-06-22 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Full… 9 Resort Hot… Portug… 1 2015-04-07 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Bed … 10 Resort Hot… Portug… 1 2015-04-17 2015-07-01 2 0 0 Half… # … with 119,376 more rows, 16 more variables: market_segment , # distribution_channel , is_repeated_guest , # previous_cancellations , previous_bookings_not_canceled , # reserved_room_type , assigned_room_type , booking_changes , # deposit_type , days_in_waiting_list , customer_type , # adr , required_car_parking_spaces , # total_of_special_requests , reservation_status , … ``` ::: ::: ## Potential Research Question From this dataset following research questions can be answered - In what location do the customers prefer to stay? It's clear from the statistics that 40.7% of the people are staying in the location PRT. If someone is planning on building or investing in a hotel, then these statistics can give a clear idea. - What percent of people stay with children and babies? With this question, hotels can make sure sufficient resources are available for children and babies - What kind of meals do customers prefer? This question can answer things like what kind of meals do prefer when living in a hotel and also help hotels to make food arrangements. - Customer_type answers what type of customers are staying in hotels. ## Descriptive Visualizations ### 1. Booking Analysis ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} CountBookingsYear <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( arrival_date_year = as.character(year(arrival_date)), #arrival_date_year = factor(arrival_date_month, levels = month.name), is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(hotel, arrival_date_year) %>% count() #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) CountBookingsYear ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 3 # Groups: hotel, arrival_date_year [6] hotel arrival_date_year n 1 City Hotel 2015 13678 2 City Hotel 2016 38140 3 City Hotel 2017 27508 4 Resort Hotel 2015 8314 5 Resort Hotel 2016 18567 6 Resort Hotel 2017 13179 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplotly(ggplot(CountBookingsYear,aes(x=arrival_date_year, y = n, col = hotel, group = 1)) + geom_line() + geom_point() + labs(title="Bookings in various hotels by months", y="Number of bookings")) # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} CountBookingsMonth <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( arrival_date_month = month.name[month(arrival_date)], arrival_date_month = factor(arrival_date_month, levels = month.name), is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(hotel, arrival_date_month) %>% count() #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) CountBookingsMonth ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 24 × 3 # Groups: hotel, arrival_date_month [24] hotel arrival_date_month n 1 City Hotel January 3736 2 City Hotel February 4965 3 City Hotel March 6458 4 City Hotel April 7480 5 City Hotel May 8232 6 City Hotel June 7894 7 City Hotel July 8088 8 City Hotel August 8979 9 City Hotel September 7400 10 City Hotel October 7605 # … with 14 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplotly(ggplot(CountBookingsMonth,aes(x=arrival_date_month, y = n, col = hotel, group = 1)) + geom_line() + geom_point() + labs(title="Bookings in various hotels by months", y="Number of bookings") + # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=45))) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### 2. Location Analysis ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Mutation CountLocation <- tidy_data %>% count(hotel,country) %>% arrange(desc(n)) CountLocation ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 290 × 3 hotel country n 1 City Hotel Portugal 30956 2 Resort Hotel Portugal 17630 3 City Hotel France 8804 4 Resort Hotel United Kingdom 6814 5 City Hotel Germany 6084 6 City Hotel United Kingdom 5315 7 City Hotel Spain 4611 8 Resort Hotel Spain 3957 9 City Hotel Italy 3307 10 Resort Hotel Ireland 2166 # … with 280 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} CountLocation <- CountLocation %>% slice(1:5) #Plotting ggplot(CountLocation, aes(x = country, y = n, fill = hotel)) + #plot the x-axis and y-axis geom_bar( stat = "identity") + #to get the bar graph geom_text(aes(label = n, vjust = 3.2))+ # to get the labels for each bar plot labs(x = "Locations", y = "Frequency of Locations", title = "Frequency visualization of top 4 countries") #to get the labels of axis and title of the graph ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Variable used: country This visualization answers the question of at what location are most of the hotels located? There are around 178 countries where city and resort hotel are located, out of those a bar graph has been plotted for the top 5 most visited countries. We can see that PRT country has highest visitors od 48590. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Mutation CountLocation <- dataset %>% summarise(Portugal = nrow(dataset[dataset$country == 'PRT',]), Other_countries = nrow(dataset[dataset$country != 'PRT',])) %>% pivot_longer(cols = everything(),names_to = "country", values_to = "count") %>% mutate(count = (count/sum(count))*100, lcount = cumsum(count) - 0.5 * (count)) CountLocation ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 3 country count lcount 1 Portugal 40.7 20.3 2 Other_countries 59.3 70.3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(CountLocation, aes(x="", y=count, fill=country)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + geom_text(aes(y=lcount, label = round(count,2)), color = "white") + coord_polar("y", start=0) + ggtitle("Number of bookings by country of origin") + theme_void() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Mutation Portugal <- dataset[dataset$country == "PRT",] Other <- dataset[dataset$country != "PRT",] CountLocationAdr <- data.frame(Portugal = mean(Portugal$adr), Other = mean(Other$adr)) %>% pivot_longer(cols = everything(),names_to = "country", values_to = "mean_adr") %>% mutate(mean_adr = (mean_adr/sum(mean_adr))*100, lcount = cumsum(mean_adr) - 0.5 * (mean_adr)) CountLocationAdr ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 3 country mean_adr lcount 1 Portugal 45.9 22.9 2 Other 54.1 72.9 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(CountLocationAdr, aes(x="", y=mean_adr, fill=country)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + geom_text(aes(y=lcount, label = round(mean_adr,2)), color = "white") + coord_polar("y", start=0) + ggtitle("Average Daily wage by country of origin") + theme_void() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### 3. Cancellation vs non-cancellation Following are the visualizations using group_by and summarise functions ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Mutation CancelStats<- data.frame(not_cancel = nrow(dataset[dataset$is_canceled == 0,]), cancel = nrow(dataset[dataset$is_canceled == 1,])) %>% pivot_longer(cols = everything(),names_to = "status", values_to = "count") %>% mutate(count = (count/sum(count))*100, lcount = cumsum(count) - 0.5 * (count)) CancelStats ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 3 status count lcount 1 not_cancel 63.0 31.5 2 cancel 37.0 81.5 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(CancelStats, aes(x="", y=count, fill=status)) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + geom_text(aes(y=lcount, label = round(count,2)), color = "white") + coord_polar("y") + ggtitle("Average Daily wage by country of origin") + theme_void() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Mutating Cancel <- tidy_data %>% group_by(hotel, is_canceled) %>% count() %>% mutate(is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) Cancel ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 3 # Groups: hotel, is_canceled [4] hotel is_canceled n 1 City Hotel not_cancelled 46228 2 City Hotel cancelled 33098 3 Resort Hotel not_cancelled 28938 4 Resort Hotel cancelled 11122 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(Cancel,aes(x = hotel, y = n, fill = is_canceled )) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + labs(x = "Hotels", y = "Bookings", title = "Cancellations vs Non_cancellations in various hotels") #to get the labels of axis and title of the graph ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Mutating Cancel_month <- tidy_data %>% mutate(arrival_date_year = as.character(year(arrival_date))) %>% group_by(hotel, is_canceled, arrival_date_year) %>% count() %>% mutate(is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) Cancel_month ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 12 × 4 # Groups: hotel, is_canceled, arrival_date_year [12] hotel is_canceled arrival_date_year n 1 City Hotel not_cancelled 2015 7678 2 City Hotel not_cancelled 2016 22733 3 City Hotel not_cancelled 2017 15817 4 City Hotel cancelled 2015 6000 5 City Hotel cancelled 2016 15407 6 City Hotel cancelled 2017 11691 7 Resort Hotel not_cancelled 2015 6176 8 Resort Hotel not_cancelled 2016 13637 9 Resort Hotel not_cancelled 2017 9125 10 Resort Hotel cancelled 2015 2138 11 Resort Hotel cancelled 2016 4930 12 Resort Hotel cancelled 2017 4054 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(Cancel_month, aes(x = arrival_date_year, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + #plot the x-axis and y-axis #geom_point(aes(x = arrival_date_year, y = n, col = is_canceled)) + #geom_line(aes(y = arrival_date_year,x = n, col = is_canceled)) + #facet_wrap(vars(hotel)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + facet_wrap(vars(hotel)) + labs(x = "Year", y = "Count", title = "Cancellations vs Non_cancellations in various hotels by years") #to get the labels of axis and title of the graph ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} CountCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( arrival_date_month = month.name[month(arrival_date)], arrival_date_month = factor(arrival_date_month, levels = month.name), is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(hotel, is_canceled, arrival_date_month) %>% count(is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) CountCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 48 × 4 # Groups: hotel, is_canceled, arrival_date_month [48] hotel is_canceled arrival_date_month n 1 City Hotel cancelled January 1482 2 City Hotel cancelled February 1901 3 City Hotel cancelled March 2386 4 City Hotel cancelled April 3465 5 City Hotel cancelled May 3653 6 City Hotel cancelled June 3528 7 City Hotel cancelled July 3306 8 City Hotel cancelled August 3598 9 City Hotel cancelled September 3110 10 City Hotel cancelled October 3268 # … with 38 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplotly(ggplot(CountCancellations,aes(x=arrival_date_month, y = n, col = is_canceled, group = 1)) + geom_line() + geom_point() + facet_wrap(vars(hotel)) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations in various hotels by months", y="Number of bookings") + # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=45))) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} DepositsCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(deposit_type, is_canceled) %>% count(deposit_type, is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) DepositsCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 3 # Groups: deposit_type, is_canceled [6] deposit_type is_canceled n 1 No Deposit cancelled 29690 2 No Deposit not_cancelled 74947 3 Non Refund cancelled 14494 4 Non Refund not_cancelled 93 5 Refundable cancelled 36 6 Refundable not_cancelled 126 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(DepositsCancellations,aes(x=deposit_type, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations by deposit_type", y="Number of bookings") # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=45)) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} MarketCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(market_segment, is_canceled) %>% count(market_segment, is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) MarketCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 14 × 3 # Groups: market_segment, is_canceled [14] market_segment is_canceled n 1 Aviation cancelled 52 2 Aviation not_cancelled 185 3 Complementary cancelled 97 4 Complementary not_cancelled 646 5 Corporate cancelled 992 6 Corporate not_cancelled 4303 7 Direct cancelled 1933 8 Direct not_cancelled 10672 9 Groups cancelled 12097 10 Groups not_cancelled 7714 11 Offline TA/TO cancelled 8311 12 Offline TA/TO not_cancelled 15908 13 Online TA cancelled 20738 14 Online TA not_cancelled 35738 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(MarketCancellations,aes(x=market_segment, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations by market segment", y="Number of bookings") + # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=45)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} CustomerCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(customer_type, is_canceled) %>% count(customer_type, is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) CustomerCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 × 3 # Groups: customer_type, is_canceled [8] customer_type is_canceled n 1 Contract cancelled 1262 2 Contract not_cancelled 2814 3 Group cancelled 59 4 Group not_cancelled 518 5 Transient cancelled 36514 6 Transient not_cancelled 53099 7 Transient-Party cancelled 6385 8 Transient-Party not_cancelled 18735 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(CustomerCancellations,aes(x=customer_type, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations by customer type", y="Number of bookings") + # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=45)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} RequestCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(total_of_special_requests, is_canceled) %>% count(total_of_special_requests, is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) RequestCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 12 × 3 # Groups: total_of_special_requests, is_canceled [12] total_of_special_requests is_canceled n 1 0 cancelled 33556 2 0 not_cancelled 36762 3 1 cancelled 7315 4 1 not_cancelled 25908 5 2 cancelled 2865 6 2 not_cancelled 10103 7 3 cancelled 446 8 3 not_cancelled 2051 9 4 cancelled 36 10 4 not_cancelled 304 11 5 cancelled 2 12 5 not_cancelled 38 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} colour_pallete <- c("black","red") #colour_pallete <- c(colour_pallete,rev(colour_palette) ) #Plotting ggplot(RequestCancellations,aes(x=total_of_special_requests, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge" ) + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + scale_fill_manual(values = c("black","red")) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations by total_of_special_requests", y="Number of bookings") # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ReservationCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(reservation_status, is_canceled) %>% count(reservation_status, is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) ReservationCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 3 # Groups: reservation_status, is_canceled [3] reservation_status is_canceled n 1 Canceled cancelled 43013 2 Check-Out not_cancelled 75166 3 No-Show cancelled 1207 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(ReservationCancellations,aes(x=reservation_status, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations by reservation_statusts", y="Number of bookings") # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} RepeatedCancellations <- tidy_data %>% #mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="year")) %>% mutate( is_repeated_guest = as.character(is_repeated_guest), is_repeated_guest = recode(is_repeated_guest, "0" = "not repeated", "1" = "repeated"), is_canceled = as.character(is_canceled), is_canceled = recode(is_canceled, "1" = "cancelled", "0" = "not_cancelled")) %>% group_by(is_repeated_guest, is_canceled) %>% count(is_repeated_guest, is_canceled) #%>% # arrange(arrival_date_month) RepeatedCancellations ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 3 # Groups: is_repeated_guest, is_canceled [4] is_repeated_guest is_canceled n 1 not repeated cancelled 43668 2 not repeated not_cancelled 71908 3 repeated cancelled 552 4 repeated not_cancelled 3258 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} #Plotting ggplot(RepeatedCancellations,aes(x=is_repeated_guest, y = n, fill = is_canceled)) + geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") + #to get the bar graph geom_text( aes(label = signif(n)), position = position_dodge(.9), size = 3, vjust = -0.5) + labs(title="Cancellations vs Non_cancellations by repeated guest", y="Number of bookings") # title and caption # change to monthly ticks and labels ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### 4. Other Analysis ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} CountMeals <- tidy_data %>% mutate(month=floor_date(arrival_date,unit="month")) %>% group_by(hotel, meal, month) %>% count(hotel,meal) CountMeals ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 190 × 4 # Groups: hotel, meal, month [190] hotel meal month n 1 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2015-07-01 1071 2 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2015-08-01 1877 3 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2015-09-01 2836 4 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2015-10-01 2821 5 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2015-11-01 1148 6 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2015-12-01 1436 7 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2016-01-01 1114 8 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2016-02-01 2028 9 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2016-03-01 2429 10 City Hotel Bed and Breakfast 2016-04-01 2791 # … with 180 more rows ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(CountMeals, aes(x = month, y = n, col = meal)) + #plot the x-axis and y-axis geom_line() + facet_wrap(vars(hotel)) + labs(x = "Hotels", y = "Percentage", title = "Meal Preference percentage") #to get the labels of axis and title of the graph ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Variable used: meal. The above visualization answers the question what meals do people prefer? We can see that 77% of the people prefer "BB" meal. The least prefered meal is "FB". ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tidy_data %>% group_by(hotel) %>% summarise(parking = sum(required_car_parking_spaces)) %>% ggplot(aes(x = hotel, y = parking)) + geom_bar(fill = "brown", color="black", stat = "identity") + #to get the bar graph geom_text(aes(label = parking), vjust = -0.5)+ # to get the labels for each bar plot labs(x = "Hotels", y = "Number of Parking Spaces", title = "Parking spaces required for various hotels") #to get the labels of axis and title of the graph ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](FinalProject_PriyaMarla_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: In this visualization we'll know how many parking spaces are required for different hotels. From the above plot, city hotel takes up 1933 parking spaces and Resort hotel requires 5531 parking spaces. ## Future Scope There is more scope for visualizations in this dataset like - using multiple variables to plot a single graph over the period of time. - one of the example is hotel in a particular country having a non canceled booking in a particular year. I'm planning on covering such multi variable plots in my final project. :::
